alert.note: Alert for Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:50AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan, northeastern Bell, east central Knox, Letcher, Leslie, Perry, southern Knott, south central Breathitt, southwestern Pike and southeastern Clay Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1250 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Leburn to Gilley to Barnyard. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hindman, Pippa Passes, Diane, Hiram, Mallie, Ivis, Garner, Totz, Gilley and Brinkley around 1255 AM EDT. Bath, Drew, Kite, Nealy, May, Pine Top, Lejunior, Kingdom Come S.P., Closplint and Black Bottom around 100 AM EDT. Cumberland, Lynch, Benham, Clover, Ivan, Hall, Omaha, Clutts, Holmes Mill and Blair around 105 AM EDT. Rock House, Greenleaf, Clover Fork, Deane, Democrat, Kettle Island, Lester, Miracle, Lucastown and Polly around 110 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Jenkins, Fleming-Neon, Wallins Creek, Stony Fork Junction, Big Black Mountain, Molus, Blackmont, Speight, Ehkhorn Mine and McRoberts. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway near mile marker 46, and between mile markers 48 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 9. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. U.S. Highway 23 in Lethcher County between mile markers 1 and 7. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike
